member.name: T:StardewUI.MenuActivationMode
member.summary: Available behaviors for opening a .

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuActivationMode.Standalone
member.summary: Opens the menu as standalone, replacing any previously-open menu and all of its descendants.

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuActivationMode.Child
member.summary: Opens the menu as a child of the frontmost game menu that is already active.
member.remarks: If no other menu is active, has the same behavior as .

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuActivationMode.Sibling
member.summary: Replaces the frontmost game menu that is already active, but keeps all of its ancestors.
member.remarks: If no other menu is active, or if the active menu is also the only menu (has no parent), then this has the same behavior as .

member.name: T:StardewUI.MenuCloseBehavior
member.summary: Available behaviors for closing a .

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuCloseBehavior.Default
member.summary: Use the game's default closing logic.
member.remarks: Menu button presses (default: E, ESC, and gamepad B) on regular standalone or child menus will close the menu implicitly, via the game's update loop, using . Submenus of the will close the menu explicitly, using the same method, when the equivalent button press is directly handled.

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuCloseBehavior.Custom
member.summary: Block the game's default closing logic, but allow the menu to be closed explicitly via its method.
member.remarks: Causes to return false at all times so that the game's own update loop will never close the menu; instead, the menu's method will be called whenever a menu button is pressed, which becomes fully responsible for the menu's removal.

member.name: F:StardewUI.MenuCloseBehavior.Disabled
member.summary: Do not allow the menu to be closed by any means.
member.remarks: Causes to return false at all times, and ignores requests to close the menu via the menu buttons. If the menu is configured with a clickable close button (X image), it will be hidden when the menu is in this state.

member.name: T:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay
member.summary: Definition of an overlay - i.e. a UI element that displays over all other UI.

member.name: E:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.Close
member.summary: Event raised when the overlay is closed - i.e. removed from the current context stack.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.Parent
member.summary: The parent of this overlay, used for positioning. If not specified, then the overlay will be positioned relative to the entire UI viewport.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Horizontal alignment of the overlay relative to the edge.
member.remarks: Specifies which edge of the overlay is used for positioning, regardless of which parent edge it is aligning to. For example, a of and a of means that the overlay's left edge will be aligned to the parent's right edge; similarly, if both are set to , then the overlay's left edge is aligned to the parent's left edge.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.HorizontalParentAlignment
member.summary: Specifies which edge of the (or screen, if no parent is specified) will be used to align the overlay edge denoted by its .
member.remarks: For example, a of and a of means that the overlay's left edge will be aligned to the parent's right edge; similarly, if both are set to , then the overlay's left edge is aligned to the parent's left edge.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Vertical alignment of the overlay relative to the edge.
member.remarks: Specifies which edge of the overlay is used for positioning, regardless of which parent edge it is aligning to. For example, a of and a of means that the overlay's top edge will be aligned to the parent's bottom edge; similarly, if both are set to , then the overlay's top edge is aligned to the parent's top edge.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.VerticalParentAlignment
member.summary: Specifies which edge of the (or screen, if no parent is specified) will be used to align the overlay edge denoted by its .
member.remarks: For example, a of and a of means that the overlay's top edge will be aligned to the parent's bottom edge; similarly, if both are set to , then the overlay's top edge is aligned to the parent's top edge.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.ParentOffset
member.summary: Additional pixel offset to apply to the overlay's position, after alignments.

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.CapturingInput
member.summary: Whether the overlay wants to capture all keyboard and gamepad inputs, i.e. prevent them from being dispatched to the parent menu.
member.remarks: This is not necessary to trap focus, which happens automatically; only to capture buttons/keys that would normally have a navigation function, like triggers/shoulders for paging, E/Esc/GamepadB for cancellation, etc. Overlays that enable capturing should provide their own way for the user to escape using keyboard/gamepad, although it is always possible to click the mouse outside the overlay to dismiss it (and implicitly stop the capturing).

member.name: P:StardewUI.Overlays.IOverlay.DimmingAmount
member.summary: Amount to dim whatever is underneath the overlay.
member.remarks: This is an alpha value for a black overlay, so the higher value (between 0 and 1) the darker the content underneath the overlay. These apply individually to each overlay, so multiple stacked overlays will dim not only the underlying main view but also any previous overlays.

member.name: T:StardewUI.View
member.summary: Base class for typical widgets wanting to implement .
member.remarks: Use of this class isn't required, but provides some useful behaviors so that view types don't need to keep re-implementing them, such as a standard implementation that skips unnecessary layouts.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.ButtonPress
member.summary: Event raised when any button on any input device is pressed.
member.remarks: Only the views in the current focus path should receive these events.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.ButtonRepeat
member.summary: Event raised when a button is being held while the view is in focus, and has been held long enough since the initial or the previous ButtonRepeat to trigger a repeated press.

remarks.para: Because the game has its own logic to repeat key presses, which would cause to fire repeatedly, this event generally applies only to the controller; that is, it exists to allow callers to decide whether they want the handler to repeat while the button is held or to only fire when first pressed, providing slightly more control than keyboard events whose repetition is up to the whims of the vanilla game.
Only the views in the current focus path should receive these events.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.Click
member.summary: Event raised when the view receives a click.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.Drag
member.summary: Event raised when the view is being dragged using the mouse.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.DragEnd
member.summary: Event raised when mouse dragging is stopped, i.e. when the button is released. Always raised after the last , and only once per drag operation.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.DragStart
member.summary: Event raised when mouse dragging is first activated. Always raised before the first , and only once per drag operation.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.LeftClick
member.summary: Event raised when the view receives a click initiated from the left mouse button, or the controller's action button (A).

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.PointerEnter
member.summary: Event raised when the pointer enters the view.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.PointerLeave
member.summary: Event raised when the pointer exits the view.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.PointerMove
member.summary: Event raised when the pointer moves within the view.

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.RightClick
member.summary: Event raised when the view receives a click initiated from the right mouse button, or the controller's tool-use button (X).

member.name: E:StardewUI.View.Wheel
member.summary: Event raised when the scroll wheel moves.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.IsDrawing
member.summary: Indicates whether a UI-initiated drawing operation is in progress, from any view.
member.remarks: This state is primarily used by Framework patches as a way to limit their effective scope and avoid interfering with vanilla or 3P draws.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.BorderSize
member.summary: The layout size (not edge thickness) of the entire drawn area including the border, i.e. the plus any borders defined in . Does not include the .

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.ContentSize
member.summary: The size of the view's content, which is drawn inside the padding. Subclasses set this in their method and padding, margins, etc. are handled automatically.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Draggable
member.summary: Whether or not this view should fire drag events such as and .

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Focusable
member.summary: Whether or not the view should be able to receive focus. Applies only to this specific view, not its children.
member.remarks: All views are non-focusable by default and must have their focus enabled explicitly. Subclasses may choose to override the default value if they should always be focusable.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.InnerSize
member.summary: The size allocated to the entire area inside the border, i.e. plus any . Does not include border or .

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Layout
member.summary: Layout settings for this view; determines how its dimensions will be computed.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Margin
member.summary: Margins (whitespace outside border) for this view.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Name
member.summary: Simple name for this view, used in log/debug output; does not affect behavior.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity (alpha level) of the view.
member.remarks: Affects this view and all descendants; used to control opacity of an entire control or layout area.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.OuterSize
member.summary: The size of the entire area occupied by this view including margins, border and padding.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Padding
member.summary: Padding (whitespace inside border) for this view.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.PointerEventsEnabled
member.summary: Whether this view should receive pointer events like or .
member.remarks: By default, all views receive pointer events; this may be disabled for views that intentionally overlap other views but shouldn't block their input, such as local non-modal overlays.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.ScrollWithChildren
member.summary: If set to an axis, specifies that when any child of the view is scrolled into view (using ), then this entire view should be scrolled along with it.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Tags
member.summary: The user-defined tags for this view.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Transform
member.summary: Local transformation to apply to this view, including any children and floating elements.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Tooltip
member.summary: Localized tooltip to display on hover, if any.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.Visibility
member.summary: Visibility for this view.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.ZIndex
member.summary: Z order for this view within its direct parent. Higher indices draw later (on top).

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.HandlesOpacity
member.summary: Whether the specific view type handles its own opacity.

remarks.para: Subclasses can override this to provide their own, typically better optimized version of opacity; i.e. a basic text or image view could simply multiply its own background/foreground colors without requiring multiple render targets to handle the blending.
Any will still use the default opacity implementation.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.LayoutOffset
member.summary: Pixel offset of the view's content, which is applied to all pointer events and child queries.

remarks.para: If a view will internally shift content in this way without affecting layout, it should update the property to ensure correctness of pointer events and coordinate-related queries such as , instead of attempting to correct for that offset locally.

member.name: P:StardewUI.View.LastAvailableSize
member.summary: The most recent size used in a pass. Used for additional dirty checks.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.remarks: The view's will default to the simple name of its most derived .

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.Draw(StardewUI.Graphics.ISpriteBatch)
member.remarks: Drawing always happens after the measure pass, so should be known and stable at this time, as long as the implementation itself is stable.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.FocusSearch(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,StardewUI.Direction)
member.remarks: This will first call to see if the specific view type wants to implement its own focus search. If there is no focusable descendant, then this will return a reference to the current view if is true and the position is not already within the view's bounds - meaning, any focusable view can accept focus from any direction, but will not consider itself a result if it is already focused (since we are trying to "move" focus).

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.OnDispose
member.summary: Performs additional cleanup when is called.
member.remarks: The default implementation is a stub. Subclasses may override this if they require separate cleanup.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.OnUpdate(System.TimeSpan)
member.remarks: When overriding , be sure to call base.OnUpdate() to ensure that any view children also receive their updates.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.ScrollIntoView(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.ViewChild},Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.remarks: The default implementation does no scrolling of its own, only passes the request down to the child and aborts if the child returns true. Scrollable views must override this to provide scrolling behavior.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.FindFocusableDescendant(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,StardewUI.Direction)
member.summary: Searches for a focusable child within this view that is reachable in the specified , and returns a result containing the view and search path if found.
member.param: The search position, relative to where this view's content starts (after applying margin, borders and padding).
The search direction.
member.remarks: This is the same as but in pre-transformed content coordinates, and does not require checking for "self-focus" as already does this. The default implementation simply returns null as most views do not have children; subclasses with children must override this.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.GetBorderThickness
member.summary: Measures the thickness of each edge of the border, if the view has a border.

remarks.para: Used only by views that will implement a border via . The border thickness is considered during layout, and generally treated as additional for the purposes of setting allowed content size.
Borders usually have a static size, but if the thickness can change, then implementations must account for it in their dirty checking ().

member.returns: The border edge thicknesses.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.GetLocalChildren
member.summary: Gets the view's children with positions relative to the content area.

remarks.para: This has the same signature as but assumes that coordinates are in the same space as those used in , i.e. not accounting for margin/border/padding. These coordinates are automatically adjusted in the to be relative to the entire view.
The default implementation returns an empty sequence. Composite views must override this method in order for user interactions to behave correctly.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.GetLocalChildrenAt(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Searches for all views at a given position relative to the content area.
member.remarks: The default implementation performs a linear search on all children and returns all whose bounds overlap the specified . Views can override this to provide optimized implementations for their layout, or handle overlapping views.
member.param: The search position, relative to where this view's content starts (after applying margin, borders and padding).
member.returns: The views at the specified , in original layout order.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.HasOwnContent
member.summary: Checks if this view displays its own content, independent of any floating elements or children.
member.remarks: This is used by to determine whether children need to be searched. If a view provides its own content, e.g. a label or image displaying text or a sprite, or a frame displaying a background/border, then the entire view's bounds are understood to have visible content. Otherwise, the view is only considered visible as a whole if at least one child is visible, and is only visible at any given point if there is an intersecting child at that point.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.IsContentDirty
member.summary: Checks whether or not the internal content/layout has changed.
member.remarks: The base implementation of only checks if the base layout attributes have changed, i.e. , , , etc. It does not know about content/data in any subclasses; those that accept content parameters (like text) will typically use to hold that content and should implement this method to check their states.
member.returns: true if content has changed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.LogFocusSearch(System.String)
member.summary: Outputs a debug log entry with the current view type, name and specified message.
member.remarks: Used primarily for debugging focus searches and requires the DEBUG_FOCUS_SEARCH compiler flag.
member.param: The message to log in addition to the view type and name.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.OnDrawContent(StardewUI.Graphics.ISpriteBatch)

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.OnMeasure(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Performs the internal layout.

remarks.para: This is called from only when the layout is dirty (layout parameters or content changed) and a new layout is actually required. Subclasses must implement this and set once layout is complete. Typically, should be used in order to ensure that the original are respected (e.g. if the actual content size is smaller than the configured size).
The provided to the method is pre-adjusted for , , and any border determined by .

member.param: Size available in the container, after applying padding, margin and borders.

member.name: M:StardewUI.View.ResetDirty
member.summary: Resets any dirty state associated with this view.
member.remarks: This is called at the end of , so that on the next pass, all state appears clean unless it was marked dirty after the last pass completed. The default implementation is a no-op; subclasses should use it to clear any private dirty state, e.g. via .

member.name: T:StardewUI.ViewExtensions
member.summary: Commonly-used extensions for the interface and related types.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.FocusablePath(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.ViewChild})
member.summary: Returns the focusable component of the path to a view, typically a cursor target.
member.param: The view path.
member.returns: The sequence of elements ending with the last view for which is true. If there are no focusable views in the path, returns an empty sequence.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.GetDefaultFocusPath(StardewUI.IView)
member.summary: Retrieves a path to the default focus child/descendant of a view.
member.param: The view at which to start the search.
member.returns: A sequence of elements with the and position (relative to parent) at each level, starting with the specified and ending with the lowest-level in the default focus path. If no focusable descendant is found, returns an empty sequence.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.GetPathToPosition(StardewUI.IView,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a path to the view at a given position.
member.param: The view at which to start the search.
The position to search for, in coordinates relative to the .
true to prioritize a focusable child over a non-focusable child with a higher z-index in case of overlap; false to always use the topmost child.
Whether to exclude views whose is currently false. This short-circuits the pathing; if any ancestor of a view has pointer events disabled then it cannot be part of the path.
member.returns: A sequence of elements with the and position (relative to parent) at each level, starting with the specified and ending with the lowest-level that still overlaps with the specified . If no match is found, returns an empty sequence.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.GetPathToView(StardewUI.IView,StardewUI.IView)
member.summary: Retrieves the path to a descendant view.
member.remarks: This method has worst-case O(N) performance, so avoid calling it in tight loops such as draw methods, and cache the result whenever possible.
member.param: The view at which to start the search.
The descendant view to search for.
member.returns: A sequence of elements with the and position (relative to parent) at each level, starting with the specified and ending with the specified . If no match is found, returns null.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.ResolveChildPath(StardewUI.IView,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.IView})
member.summary: Takes an existing view path and resolves it with child coordinates for the view at each level.
member.param: The root view.
The path from root down to some descendant, such as the path returned by .
member.returns: A sequence of elements, starting at the , where each child's is the child's most current location within its parent.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.ToGlobalPositions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.ViewChild})
member.summary: Converts a view path in parent-relative coordinates (e.g. from and transforms each element to have an absolute .
member.remarks: Since does not specify whether the position is local (parent) or global (absolute), it is not possible to validate the incoming sequence and prevent a "double transformation". Callers are responsible for knowing whether or not the input sequence is local or global.
member.param: The path from root down to leaf view.
member.returns: The with positions in global coordinates.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.ZOrder(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.ViewChild},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts a sequence of children in ascending z-order.
member.remarks: Order is preserved between views with the same , so the resulting sequence will have a primary order of z-index (lower indices first) and a secondary order of original sequence position. This is the correct order for drawing views.
member.param: The view children.
true to sort focusable children first regardless of z-index; false to ignore .
member.returns: The ordered by the view's and original sequence order.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewExtensions.ZOrderDescending(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StardewUI.ViewChild},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts a sequence of children in descending z-order.
member.remarks: The resulting sequence will have an order such that views with higher appear first, and views with the same z-index will appear in the reverse order of the original sequence. This is the correct order for handling cursor events and any other actions that need to operate on the "topmost" view first.
member.param: The view children.
true to sort focusable children first regardless of z-index; false to ignore .

member.remarks: Underlay is only drawn when game options do not force clear backgrounds.

member.name: P:StardewUI.ViewMenu.TooltipsEnabled
member.summary: Whether to display tooltips on mouse hover.
member.remarks: Tooltips should normally always be left enabled; one reason to disable them would be if a is set that would overlap.

member.summary: The view to display with this menu.

member.summary: Gets or sets the menu's gutter edges, which constrain the portion of the viewport in which any part of the menu may be drawn.
member.remarks: Gutters effectively shrink the viewport for both measurement (size calculation) and layout (centering) by clipping the screen edges.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewMenu.applyMovementKey(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates a focus search in the specified direction.

member.name: M:StardewUI.ViewMenu.areGamePadControlsImplemented
member.summary: Returns whether or not the menu wants exclusive gamepad controls.
member.remarks: This implementation always returns false. Contrary to what the name in Stardew's code implies, this setting is not required for to work; instead, when enabled, it suppresses the game's default mapping of button presses to clicks, and would therefore require reimplementing key-repeat and other basic behaviors. There is no reason to enable it here.
member.returns: Always false.
